feed.title: Immich Public Proxy Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for Immich Public Proxy: 1.11.4
entry.content: • 73 Show gifs animated when viewing the full image

entry.title: New release for Immich Public Proxy: 1.11.5
entry.content: • 101 Show loading spinner when there are more items still to load

entry.title: New release for Immich Public Proxy: 1.12.0
entry.content:
This release changes the way that the og:image fully-qualified URLs are generated.

Previously it would use the host header, which you could override from your reverse proxy if you wanted to customise it.

Now by default the public base URL is set in your docker-compose.yml file (see example here).

If you want to override this dynamically (for example if you're serving the same IPP instance on multiple domains), you can remove this env variable, and instead set it as a publicBaseUrl header on the request from your reverse proxy to IPP. Make sure to remove the env variable as it takes precedence.

https://github.com/alangrainger/immich-public-proxy?tab=readme-ov-file#serving-from-multiple-domains

entry.title: New release for Immich Public Proxy: 1.12.1
entry.content:
• 115 Allow inline configuration as an option rather than a separate config.json file.

If you wish, you can now pass the configuration inline from your docker-compose.yml file like this:

yaml environment: PUBLIC_BASE_URL: https://your-proxy-url.com IMMICH_URL: http://your-internal-immich-server:2283 CONFIG: | { "ipp": { "singleImageGallery": false, ... } }

entry.title: New release for Immich Public Proxy: 1.13.0
entry.content:
This release adds partial support for the new Immich custom shared link URLs. #116

Sharing a selection of images with a custom name will work, but albums and password-protected albums do not work yet.
